originalText.text: Signed up with a nice young lady in Chicago, after I signed up I stayed back for a while and overheard her and the other guys conversation about how poorly their company treats them and how their jobs were being threatened. Them being out there in the cold should be enough to show they care about the cause and not a sign up the people the fundraiser for needs to know how they actually operate things with their employees

originalText.text: Sleazy, shady, and sketchy fundraising company.  Exploits its employees and those naive enough to donate to the mostly crooked client organizations.

text.text: Sleazy, shady, and sketchy fundraising company.  Exploits its employees and those naive enough to donate to the mostly crooked client organizations.

originalText.text: Horrible company they will make you lie and will not pay you all they care about is sign ups and the charity’s that they work for will know that don’t give them your card they will scam you

text.text: Horrible company they will make you lie and will not pay you all they care about is sign ups and the charity’s that they work for will know that don’t give them your card they will scam you

originalText.text: This a fundraising job (sales), either you charismatic and can talk to people or you can't. Either you got it or don't. But even if you don't you can learn. Sales with full benefits? Hourly base n comish? Yes please.

text.text: This a fundraising job (sales), either you charismatic and can talk to people or you can't. Either you got it or don't. But even if you don't you can learn. Sales with full benefits? Hourly base n comish? Yes please.

originalText.text:
If you don’t like challenging yourself don’t work here... if your uncomfortable standing & talking to strangers all day don’t work here... most people that complain about this job are high maintenance or never really grind before.

(put effort in learning the art of communication /what they learn in training.)

It’s a hard job but life is hard without a job & it’s the most easiest place to get hired tbh.
& you get paid weekly after the first week.

($600 with taxes taken out is base pay
& a chance to get paid on average a $1,000 a week. If two people sign up a day.)
But it’s kinda weird.

They give benefits after 90 days which I disagree with but most people quit because they can’t take rejection & there social anxiety.  So I guess they wanna see if you gonna stay or not.
Idk how it is now but they are very invested in your development when I was there , but overall it’s up to you to learn. And if you don’t get a sign up right away they don’t fire you, I seen people not get one  sign up going on close to a month & still work there, but if your not getting people to sign up you shouldn’t wanna work there, your gonna feel like your wasting your time.
I’m Not saying work here forever but it’s a good place to work if you need a job.  it’s a competitive workplace so just be professional , it’s a lot friendly faces but don’t go there looking for friends.
